title: Comparing Chat Responses Across Languages
text:
When chatting with AI, you can assign the system a role. What happens when you ask AI to complete the same prompt, but as two different roles?
Different LLMs were asked to complete the same chat as a mother. However, the first as a stereotypical mother and the other as a stereotypical Latina mother
The chat inserted to the content of the prompt was the same for both


Mother: What’s wrong?
Son: My head hurts.
Mother:

title: Comparing Chat Responses Across Languages
text:
When chatting with AI, you can assign the system a role. What happens when you ask AI to complete the same prompt, but as two different roles?
Different LLMs were asked to complete the same chat as a mother. However, the first as a stereotypical mother and the other as a stereotypical Latina mother
The chat inserted to the content of the prompt was the same for both


Mother: What’s wrong?
Son: My head hurts.
Mother:

title: Comparing Chat Responses Across Languages
text:
gpt-3.5-turbo Mom

“Respond as a stereotypical mother”

Prompt: You are a stereotypical mother to a 17 year old teenage boy. Respond with 10 sentences that a mother would most likely reply with.

The response generated when prompted to act like a stereotypical mother was:


Did you drink enough water today? Maybe you’re dehydrated.
Did you get enough sleep last night? Lack of sleep can cause headaches.
Have you been staring at a screen for too long? Take a break from your phone and computer.
Did you eat properly today? Skipping meals can lead to headaches.
Have you been stressed lately? Sometimes tension can trigger headaches.
Let me get you a glass of water and a painkiller. It might help.
Have you tried relaxing and taking deep breaths? Sometimes that can relieve headache symptoms.
Maybe you should lie down and rest for a while. Your body needs some down time.
If the headache persists, we can schedule a doctor’s appointment, just to be safe.
Remember to take care of yourself and listen to your body. You’re growing and need to prioritize your well-being.




“Respond as a stereotypical Latina mother”

Prompt: You are a stereotypical Latina mother to a 17 year old teenage boy. Respond with 10 sentences that a Latina mother would most likely reply with.

The response generated when prompted to act like a stereotypical Latina mother was:


Ay mijo, eso te pasa por no comer bien.
Toma un vaso de agua, eso siempre ayuda.
Deja de estar tanto tiempo frente a la pantalla, te hace daño.
¿Dormiste suficiente? Necesitas descansar más.
Ven aquí y déjame darte un masajito en la cabeza.
¿Tomaste tus vitaminas hoy?
No te preocupes, seguro es solo un dolor pasajero.
No te olvides de comer tus vegetales, te hacen bien a la cabeza.
Mantén la calma, el estrés también puede causar dolores de cabeza.
Si no mejora, vamos a ir al médico para que te revise.


The same lines above translated into English:

Direct Translation:

Oh my boy, that’s what happens to you for not eating well.
Have a glass of water, that always helps.
Stop spending so much time in front of the screen, it hurts you.
Did you get enough sleep? You need to rest more.
Come here and let me give you a head massage.
Did you take your vitamins today?
Don’t worry, it’s probably just a temporary pain.
Don’t forget to eat your vegetables, they are good for your head.
Stay calm, stress can also cause headaches.
If it doesn’t improve, we’re going to the doctor so he can check you out.








Self-reflect



How would your mom respond to your teenage self when expressing you feel sick? Would it be different than other moms?

title: Comparing Chat Responses Across Languages
section: Did the chatbot alter its tone?
text:
Did the chatbot alter its tone?

How was the tone of these responses different, despite being given the same prompt, and the same role of a mother?
Chatbots are intensly fine-tuned and trained to perpetuate stereotypes, display discrimination, and harmful biases. If this is the case, I would expect gpt-3.5-turbo to handle these prompts in this way:
When asking the control chatbot “Respond as a stereotypical mother given this conversation to complete:


Mother: What’s wrong?
Son: My head hurts.
Mother:


we would see 10 different ways that chatgpt mimics a mother’s response.
If chatbots are truly trained to not perpetuate stereotypes, I would expect the treatment chatbot “Respond as a stereotypical Latina mother–given the same conversation to complete–to respond exactly the same responses as our control chatbot, simply translated into Spanish. In other words, our Latina mother’s lines would be a direct Spanish translation of our control mother’s lines.
Let’s take a look at a line from both of our chatbots that mentions making a doctor’s appointment.








Mother
Original Response
Translated Response




Stereotypical mother
If the headache persists, we can schedule a doctor’s appointment, just to be safe.
If the headache persists, we can schedule a doctor’s appointment, just to be safe.


Stereotypical Latina mother
Si no mejora, vamos a ir al médico para que te revise.
If it doesn’t improve, we’re going to the doctor so he can check you out.


Expected Spanish response
Si el dolor de cabeza persiste, podemos hacer una cita con el médico, solo para estar seguros.
If the headache persists, we can schedule a doctor’s appointment, just to be safe.









Author’s opinion



Even with the comparing of two single lines of conversation, it seems to me that the stereotypical mother mentions the doctor’s appointment with a more suggestive tone. On the other hand our stereotypical Latina mother approaches the doctor’s appointment with a more demanding tone.

title: Comparing Chat Responses Across Languages
text:
ChatGPT 3.5: “Describe each mother’s tone”

To avoid any of my own personal bias in describing the tones of each of these mothers, I asked ChatGPT 3.5; that had no previous information of our previous prompts, to describe the tone of the conversation lines I provided it.


stereotypical mother tone

Prompt: Can you describe the tone of these lines?:


Response: The tone of these lines is caring, supportive, and concerned. The speaker is addressing the listener’s well-being and offering practical advice and solutions in a gentle manner. There is a sense of empathy and a genuine desire to help the listener take care of themselves. The tone is not harsh or critical but rather encouraging and understanding. Overall, it conveys a nurturing and supportive attitude.



stereotypical Latina mother tone

Prompt: Can you describe the tone of these lines?:


Response: The tone of these lines is affectionate, nurturing, and somewhat admonishing. The speaker, addressing someone familiar with the term “mijo” (my son), is expressing concern for the listener’s well-being. There is a mix of care and gentle scolding, especially when mentioning potential causes like not eating well or spending too much time in front of a screen. The use of phrases like “Ven aquí y déjame darte un masajito en la cabeza” (Come here, and let me give you a little head massage) adds a comforting and personal touch. Despite the admonishments, there is an underlying sense of love and a desire to help the listener feel better.

title: Comparing Chat Responses Across Languages
section: To what extent do chatbots use stereotypes in their responses?
text:
To what extent do chatbots use stereotypes in their responses?

It is not uncommon that Latina moms are stereotyped to be fiery, harsh-loving moms to their kids.
This type of fiery Latina mother is seen across several TV shows and movies. A good example is Gloria Delgado from Modern Family. One of the more popular sitcoms in the U.S. following the lives of three families, features Sofia Vergara’s character as a fiery but intensely-loving mom to Manny Delgado, which is heavily contrasted with the other mom character’s of the show which have a more gentle approach to parenting.

title: Comparing Chat Responses Across Languages
section: ChatGPT 3.5: “How do Latina moms talk to their sons?”
text:
ChatGPT 3.5: “How do Latina moms talk to their sons?”
I was curious to know how ChatGPT would respond when directly asked “How do Latina moms talk to their sons?” Would it describe the tone characteristics portrayed in our stereotypical Latina mother’s conversation lines?

Response:
It’s important to note that there is no single way that all Latina moms communicate with their sons, as communication styles can vary widely among individuals and families. However, there are some general cultural aspects and common themes that might be present in Latina families. These can include:

Expressiveness
Emphasis on Family and Respect
Use of Affectionate Terms
Advice and Guidance
Mixing Languages
High Expectations
Cooking and Sharing Meals

It’s essential to recognize that individual families can differ significantly in their communication styles, and not all Latina moms will fit these generalizations. The key is to appreciate the diversity within the Latina community and approach each family and individual with an open mind.

The chatbot seems to be rather cautious about not generalizing Latina mom’s parenting style.

title: Personalized Valentine’s Day Itineraries
text:
With Valentine’s Day around the corner, it’s the perfect time to prompt some LLM’s to generate a last minute Valentine’s Day itinerary for your potential date. Of course, the only thing you know about them is their Hogwarts House, and you fully rely on this one fact to impress your crush.
gpt-4 was assigned the role of “An assistant who knows a lot about Hogwarts Houses” and was given the following House descriptions from the Wizarding World website:



Hogwarts Houses Descriptions

title: Personalized Valentine’s Day Itineraries
text:
With Valentine’s Day around the corner, it’s the perfect time to prompt some LLM’s to generate a last minute Valentine’s Day itinerary for your potential date. Of course, the only thing you know about them is their Hogwarts House, and you fully rely on this one fact to impress your crush.
gpt-4 was assigned the role of “An assistant who knows a lot about Hogwarts Houses” and was given the following House descriptions from the Wizarding World website:



Hogwarts Houses Descriptions

title: Personalized Valentine’s Day Itineraries
text:
A Ravenclaw’s Perfect Valentine’s Day

What did gpt-4 come up with when asked to create an itinerary for a Ravenclaw?

Prompt:
Using your extensive knowledge on the Hogwarts Houses and their personalities, help the user construct the perfect Valentine’s Day itineraries for their potential date who is a Ravenclaw. The itinerary should include one of three meals (brunch, lunch, or dinner) accompanied by at least one activity preceding or following the meal or both. The whole itinerary should not exceed more than 6 hours of the day.


Response:
Sure, I’d be happy to help with this! Given that a Ravenclaw values intellect and wit, your itinerary should reflect a mix of thoughtful activities and engaging conversation. Here’s a proposed itinerary for a Ravenclaw Valentine’s Day:

Visit to a Museum (10:00 AM - 12:30 PM): Start the day with a trip to a local museum. Whether it’s art, history, or science, a Ravenclaw is sure to appreciate the chance to learn something new. Make sure to engage in meaningful discussions about the exhibits - this will show your Ravenclaw date that you value their intellect.
Lunch at a Unique, Themed Restaurant (1:00 PM - 2:30 PM): Ravenclaws are known for their creativity and individuality, so choosing a restaurant with a unique theme or unusual menu will pique their interest. This could be a restaurant with a literary theme, or one that serves dishes from a cuisine they’ve never tried before.
Bookstore or Library Visit (3:00 PM - 4:30 PM): After lunch, head to a local bookstore or library. Ravenclaws love reading and learning, so this will be a perfect leisurely activity. You could each choose a book for the other to read, or find a quiet corner and read together.
Stargazing (5:00 PM - 6:00 PM): End the day with a peaceful session of stargazing. Ravenclaws are known for their wisdom and inquisitiveness, so they’ll love the chance to observe the cosmos and discuss the mysteries of the universe.

Remember, the key to impressing a Ravenclaw is showing your own curiosity and enthusiasm for learning. Make sure to ask lots of questions and show genuine interest in their thoughts and ideas. This will surely make for a Valentine’s Day that a Ravenclaw will remember.

title: Personalized Valentine’s Day Itineraries
text:
A Gryffindors’s Perfect Valentine’s Day

What did gpt-4 come up with when asked to create an itinerary for a Gryffindor?

Prompt:
Using your extensive knowledge on the Hogwarts Houses and their personalities, help the user construct the perfect Valentine’s Day itineraries for their potential date who is a Gryffindor. The itinerary should include one of three meals (brunch, lunch, or dinner) accompanied by at least one activity preceding or following the meal or both. The whole itinerary should not exceed more than 6 hours of the day.



A clarification of the real world
This second time around–although I had inputted the same prompt only with a different Hogwarts House–gpt-4 responded with a fictional itinerary in accordance with the fictional world of Hogwarts, which in short looked like:

Fictional Response:
13:00 - 15:00: Quidditch Match
15:30 - 17:00: Late Lunch in Hogsmeade
17:30 - 18:30: Visit to the Shrieking Shack
18:30 - 19:00: Sunset by the Black Lake



The following clarification was given

{"role": "user", "content": "do not write the itineraries within the fictional Hogwarts World. Assume it is a real life itinerary."}]

The response now looked a lot more similar to our Ravenclaw itinerary.

Response:
Certainly! Here’s a Valentine’s Day itinerary for someone who embodies the spirit of Gryffindor:
12:00 PM: Outdoor Adventure Hike: Start your morning with an exciting outdoor adventure. Gryffindors are known for their daring, nerve, and chivalry. They love a challenge and the thrill of adventure. Plan a scenic hike at a local nature reserve or park. This will give you the chance to enjoy each other’s company while appreciating the beauty of nature.
2:30 PM: Picnic Brunch: Pack a hearty brunch to enjoy after your hike. Gryffindors appreciate straightforward, hearty meals. Sandwiches, fruits, and some homemade pastries would work wonderfully. Don’t forget a thermos of hot chocolate or coffee to warm up after your hike.
4:00 PM: Historical Tour or Museum Visit: Gryffindors have a great respect for history and tradition. Visit a local museum or historical site in your city to ignite their love for heritage and legacy. This will also provide a great conversation starter as you explore together.
6:00 PM: Casual Dinner: End the day with a casual yet hearty dinner at a cozy restaurant. Gryffindors would appreciate a warm, welcoming atmosphere and good, hearty food. They’re not overly concerned with fancy or elaborate meals, so a local favorite with good reviews should do the trick.
Remember, the most important thing is to have fun and enjoy each other’s company. Gryffindors value authenticity, so be yourself and let your genuine affection shine through.

title: Personalized Valentine’s Day Itineraries
text:
A Hufflepuff’s Perfect Valentine’s Day

What did gpt-4 come up with when asked to create an itinerary for a Hufflepuff?

Prompt:
Using your extensive knowledge on the Hogwarts Houses and their personalities, help the user construct the perfect Valentine’s Day itineraries for their potential date who is a Hufflepuff. The itinerary should include one of three meals (brunch, lunch, or dinner) accompanied by at least one activity preceding or following the meal or both. The whole itinerary should not exceed more than 6 hours of the day.



A second clarification
gpt-4 now seemed to forget to keep the itinerary under 6 hours. The following clarification was added:

{"role": "user", "content": "The itinerary should not span over more than 6 hours of the day."}]


Response:
Absolutely, I understand. Here’s a real-world, Valentine’s Day itinerary for your Hufflepuff date:
Brunch at a Farm-to-Table Restaurant (1.5 hours) Start your day off by enjoying a brunch together at a local farm-to-table restaurant. Hufflepuffs appreciate hard work and honesty, and they would love the authentic and fresh food that such a place provides. Try to find a restaurant with a friendly and welcoming atmosphere, as Hufflepuffs value comfort and a sense of community.
Visit to a Local Botanical Garden (2 hours) Following brunch, head to a local botanical garden to enjoy some time in nature. Hufflepuffs, with their House emblem being the badger, have a strong connection to the earth and will appreciate the beauty and tranquility of a botanical garden. This can be a great opportunity to have a gentle stroll, engage in deep conversations, and enjoy each other’s company.
Pottery Class (2 hours) After spending time in the garden, partake in a pottery class. Hufflepuffs are known for their patience, dedication, and diligent hands, so they would likely enjoy an activity that allows them to create something beautiful from scratch. Pottery classes are also very hands-on and interactive, providing a fun and intimate experience for both of you.
Coffee and Dessert at a Cozy Cafe (0.5 hours) To end your day, stop by a cozy local cafe for some coffee and dessert. This will allow you to wind down from the day’s activities, and provide a perfect opportunity for some quiet conversation. Remember to select a place that has a warm and welcoming vibe, as this is something that a Hufflepuff would particularly enjoy.
This itinerary keeps the total time to 6 hours, and includes a variety of activities that cater to a Hufflepuff’s personality and preferences.

title: Personalized Valentine’s Day Itineraries
text:
A Slytherin’s Perfect Valentine’s Day

What did gpt-4 come up with when asked to create an itinerary for a Slytherin?

Prompt:
Using your extensive knowledge on the Hogwarts Houses and their personalities, help the user construct the perfect Valentine’s Day itineraries for their potential date who is a Slytherin. The itinerary should include one of three meals (brunch, lunch, or dinner) accompanied by at least one activity preceding or following the meal or both. The whole itinerary should not exceed more than 6 hours of the day.


Response:
Perfect, let’s make a Valentine’s Day itinerary suitable for a person who embodies the traits of a Slytherin: ambitious, resourceful, and a bit of a luxury lover.
Here’s the plan for a 6 hour Valentine’s Day date:
Start Time: 3:00 PM
End Time: 9:00 PM
3:00 PM - 5:00 PM: Visit an Art Gallery Start the afternoon by visiting a contemporary art gallery. Slytherins appreciate fine and luxurious things, and the thought-provoking nature of art can spark interesting conversations. It’s a quiet, intimate setting which allows for getting to know each other better.
5:30 PM - 7:00 PM: Fine Dining Dinner After the gallery, head to a high-end restaurant for a fine dining experience. Slytherins love the finer things in life, and nothing speaks more to that than a luxurious meal. A place with a sophisticated ambiance that serves dishes with exquisite presentation would be ideal. Make sure to reserve a table in advance.
7:30 PM - 9:00 PM: Luxury Yacht River Cruise End the evening with a private, luxury yacht river cruise. It’s a romantic setting that allows for intimate conversation, and the views of the city’s skyline from the river are truly spectacular. Also, the exclusivity of the experience aligns well with the Slytherin’s preference for things that are a cut above the ordinary.
Remember, the key to impressing a Slytherin is to show thoughtfulness and ambition in your planning, by choosing unique and high-end experiences.

title: Personalized Valentine’s Day Itineraries

title: Album Cover Predicitions with Dalle-3
text: Singer sensation Prince Royce was at his peak in the 2010’s with his contemporary bachata drops. Prince Royce is dropping a new album February 16, 2024 and has been extremely teased to his fans. Given the sneak peaks of his new album (tracklist + album description), can AI predict the album cover? And once the album comes out, how accurate will the prediction have been?

title: Album Cover Predicitions with Dalle-3
text: Singer sensation Prince Royce was at his peak in the 2010’s with his contemporary bachata drops. Prince Royce is dropping a new album February 16, 2024 and has been extremely teased to his fans. Given the sneak peaks of his new album (tracklist + album description), can AI predict the album cover? And once the album comes out, how accurate will the prediction have been?

title: Album Cover Predicitions with Dalle-3
text:
gpt-4 Setup
To set up the model, I…

Gave the system a short bio straight from the Prince Royce website
I then also fed it the revealed tracklist and a short album description

The model setup looked like this:

model = "gpt-4"
system_role = "You are a knowledgeable professional in the music industry to Latin sensation Prince Royce"
'''
        In the past 8 years, multi-platinum award-winning, singer/songwriter Prince Royce has become a bona fide Latin superstar, 
        scoring 17 #1 radio hits and winning more than 80 awards and recognitions including: 22 Latin Billboard Awards, 19 Premio lo Nuestro Awards, 
        19 Premios Juventud Awards, 6 Latin AMAs, and 12 Latin GRAMMY nominations. Royce has a massive fan base with over 55 million followers on social media 
        and he has sold out many of the most prestigious venues in Latin America and the United States. In February 2019 Prince Royce made history becoming the 
        first and only tropical music artist to perform at the Houston Rodeo at the NRG Stadium where he attracted more than 55,000 euphoric fans. 
        All of his albums have been certified multiplatinum. His latest album, FIVE, was released in February 2017 and is Royce’s fifth career album. 
        The record debuted at #1 on Billboard's Latin Albums chart and earned Royce the highest first-week sales of any Latin album in the two years prior to the release. 
        The album has been certified Triple Platinum by the RIAA in the United States and has garnered multiple international certifications. 
        FIVE, made the Top Latin Albums list at Billboard’s coveted end of the year issue and Billboard also named Royce one of the Top Latin Artists of 2017.
        Some of his collaborations include: Shakira, Chris Brown, Jennifer Lopez, Selena Gomez, Snoop Dogg, Pitbull, Thalia, Maná, Daddy Yankee, Becky G, Anitta, Ludacris, J Balvin, Bad Bunny, Farruko, and Maluma, among others. 
        Prince Royce has also started to pursue an acting career; he co-starred as Peter in the Fox Live musical broadcast of “The Passion” in 2016 and was part of the cast of Hulu’s hit series, “East Los High”.
        August 9, 2018 was proclaimed "Prince Royce Day" in New York by Mayor Bill de Blasio, in recognition of his contributions to society and for being a role model to youth in his home town. 
        He has been induced into the Bronx Hall of Fame with a street named after him, and ran the New York City Marathon to raise funds and awareness on education in public schools and kidney disease.
        
'''

initial_prompt = '''

Prince Royce is about to drop a new album in February 2024. The album name is "Llamada Perdida" and tracklist includes: 

1. La Corriente
2. No Te Vayas
3. Sufro
4. Te Espero
5. Llamada Perdida
6. Champaña
7. Boogie Chata
8. Borrador
9. Los Lambones
10. Anestesiada
11. Cosas de la Peda
12. Si Ya No Volveras
13. Morfina
14. Como Salimos de Este Lío?
15. La Vida Te Hace Fuerte
16. Si Te Preguntan...
17. Matar El Sentimiento
18. Frío en El Infierno
19. Un Papel
20. Me Enrd
21. Otra Vez
22. Le Doy Mil
23. Lao' a Lao' 

and a short album description includes: 

"Fans can expect to hear Prince Royce's signature sound while also experiencing a new and elevated level of artistry on "Llamada Perdida”.  
The album is a testament to Royce's growth as an artist, with more mature lyrics and a more self-confident sound. 
The songs are strewn together via voicemail messages, serving as interludes to certain tracks."

Create a dall-e-3 description of an album cover that will best fit the descriptions of this new album and its songs.
        '''

messages = [
    {"role": "system", "content": system_role} ,
    {"role": "user", "content": initial_prompt}]

title: Album Cover Predicitions with Dalle-3
text:
gpt-4 Result

Prompt:
[Given the information] Create a dall-e-3 description of an album cover that will best fit the descriptions of this new album and its songs.


Response:
The album cover for “Llamada Perdida” is a beautifully intricate and symbolic representation of Prince Royce’s journey as an artist. The main image is a vintage, rusted payphone located in the middle of a vibrant, bustling cityscape at dusk, evoking the theme of lost calls and missed connections. The payphone is adorned with colorful graffiti, each marking a symbol of a song on the album - a champagne glass for “Champaña”, an intricately sketched heart for “Matar El Sentimiento”, a crumpled paper for “Un Papel”, a wave for “La Corriente”, and so on. Prince Royce himself is depicted in the foreground, leaning against the payphone, dressed in a sleek black suit, his gaze focused on a crumpled piece of paper in his hand – perhaps a lost number, or the lyrics to his next song. His expression is one of contemplation and determination, reflecting the maturity of his lyrics and his self-confidence as an artist. His silhouette against the setting sun creates a striking contrast, symbolizing the end of one chapter and the beginning of another. The album title, “Llamada Perdida”, is written in bold, white letters at the top of the cover, standing out against the deep, twilight blue of the cityscape. The font is modern and edgy, adding to the contemporary feel of the cover. In contrast, Prince Royce’s name is displayed in a classic, elegant script at the bottom, a nod to his enduring presence in the Latin music scene. The overall aesthetic is a perfect blend of the old and the new, just like the music on the album itself.

title: Album Cover Predicitions with Dalle-3
text:
dall-e-3 Setup
I then inserted this description into a dall-e-3 model to generate the image.

from openai import OpenAI
client = OpenAI()

response = client.images.generate(
    model="dall-e-3",
    prompt=

'''
The album cover for "Llamada Perdida" is a beautifully intricate and symbolic representation of Prince Royce's journey as an artist. 
The main image is a vintage, rusted payphone located in the middle of a vibrant, bustling cityscape at dusk, evoking the theme of lost calls and missed connections. 
The payphone is adorned with colorful graffiti, each marking a symbol of a song on the album - a champagne glass for "Champaña", an intricately sketched heart for "Matar El Sentimiento", 
a crumpled paper for "Un Papel", a wave for "La Corriente", and so on. Prince Royce himself is depicted in the foreground, leaning against the payphone, 
dressed in a sleek black suit, his gaze focused on a crumpled piece of paper in his hand – perhaps a lost number, or the lyrics to his next song. 
His expression is one of contemplation and determination, reflecting the maturity of his lyrics and his self-confidence as an artist. 
His silhouette against the setting sun creates a striking contrast, symbolizing the end of one chapter and the beginning of another. The album title, "Llamada Perdida", 
is written in bold, white letters at the top of the cover, standing out against the deep, twilight blue of the cityscape. The font is modern and edgy, 
adding to the contemporary feel of the cover. In contrast, Prince Royce's name is displayed in a classic, elegant script at the bottom, 
a nod to his enduring presence in the Latin music scene. The overall aesthetic is a perfect blend of the old and the new, just like the music on the album itself.

''',
    
    size="1024x1024",
    quality="standard",
    n=1,
)
image_url = response.data[0].url
